segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
10. Asuravagga
99. Sikkhāpadasutta
“Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
Attahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya, parahitāya paṭipanno no attahitāya, nevattahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya, attahitāya ceva paṭipanno parahitāya ca.
segments.en:
1. One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;
  2. one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;
  3. one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and
  4. one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit themselves, but not others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence. But they don’t encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit themselves, but not others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit others, but not themselves?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and uses alcoholic drinks that cause negligence. But they encourage others to not do these things.

segments.pli: attanā adinnādānā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā kāmesumicchācārā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā musāvādā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit others, but not themselves.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā appaṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti … pe … attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
segments.en: It’s when a person kills, etc. … and doesn’t encourage others to not do these things.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit both themselves and others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti … pe … attanā ca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti, parañca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t kill, etc. … and encourages others to do the same.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit both themselves and others.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
